Erowid name: lsd
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: MainPage

                    Text: 
                    LSD-25



COMMON & BRAND NAMES

Acid; L; Tabs; Blotter; Doses; Trips

EFFECTS CLASSIFICATION

Psychedelic

CHEMICAL NAME

d-lysergic acid diethylamide

DESCRIPTION

LSD is the best known and most researched psychedelic. It is the standard against which all other psychedelics are compared. It is active at extremely low doses and is most commonly available on blotter or in liquid form.

BASICS

EFFECTS

IMAGES

HEALTH

LAW

DOSE

CHEMISTRY

CAUTION: NBOMes sold as LSD/Acid

Since 2013, some blotter and liquid "acid" being sold in the Americas and Europe contains NBOMe compounds instead of LSD. The NBOMe chemicals can cause strong effects even on a single standard hit of blotter (1/4" (6mm) square). Unlike LSD, NBOMes can cause death. NBOMe compounds are usually bitter while LSD-containing liquid or blotter has only a mild metallic flavor or no flavor at all.

GENERAL INFORMATION #

LSD FAQ

LSD FAQ #2

LSD Facts

LSD & Color Blindness

LSD Purity Discussion


                    Context: 
                    This section provides a detailed overview of LSD-25, including its common names, classification as a psychedelic, chemical name, and key warnings about NBOMe adulteration. It is relevant for understanding LSD's identity, effects, legal considerations, and safety concerns within the broader Erowid resource on psychoactive substances.

Erowid name: lsd
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: MainPage

                    Text: 
                    LSD & the Army in the 60's

1962 LSD Related Death of an Elephant

Revisiting Bicycle Day, by D. Nichols

Remembrances of LSD Therapy Past (pdf)

LSD Use On the Rise, 1993

I suddenly became strangely inebriated. The external world became changed as in a dream. Objects appeared to gain inrelief; they assumed unusual dimensions; and colors became more glowing. Even self-perception and the sense of time were changed. When the eyes were closed, colored pictures flashed past in a quickly changing kaleidoscope. After a few hours, the not unpleasant inebriation, which had been experienced whilst I was fully conscious, disappeared. what had caused this condition? - - Albert Hofmann - - Laboratory Notes (1943)

CHARACTERS #

Albert Hofmann

Timothy Leary

MEDICAL USE #

Cluster Headache Treatment with Mushrooms & LSD

HEALTH #

LSD Deaths/Fatalities

Flashbacks - Information from the DSM IV

LSD & Chromosomes, from The Natural Mind

The Interactions between Hallucinogens and Antidepressants
